pullRequest.body:
Add several lemmas that proved convenient in working with `List.ofFn`.

There were two places where avoiding extra imports was awkward.  In the proof of `head_ofFn`, I wanted to rewrite with `head_eq_getElem_zero`, but `Mathlib.Data.List.Basic` isn't imported in `Mathlib.Data.List.OfFn` so I inlined an equivalent rewrite on `← getElem_zero (length_ofFn _ ▸ Nat.pos_of_ne_zero hn)` instead. `chain'_ofFn` depends on content from both `Mathlib.Data.List.OfFn` and `Mathlib.Data.List.Chain`, but neither of those imports the other. So to avoid adding extra imports or awkward local duplication of proofs, I created a new `Mathlib.Data.List.ChainOfFn` to have that one lemma.  Alternative suggestions for avoiding import creep for these lemmas are welcome.

Golfing is also welcome; the proof of `find?_ofFn_eq_some` is rather long.


---

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ chain'_ofFn`
`+ find?_eq_some_iff_getElem`
`+ find?_ofFn_eq_some`
`+ find?_ofFn_eq_some_of_injective`
`+ getLast_ofFn`
`+ getLast_ofFn_succ`
`+ head_ofFn`
`+ ofFn_cons`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:

## more verbose report:
```

</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11771559865/job/32785653484)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11771559865/job/32785653629)

You could write this as:
```lean 4
lemma head_ofFn {n} (h : ofFn f ≠ []) (f : Fin n → α) :
    (ofFn f).head h = f ⟨0, sorry⟩ := sorry
```
(replacing the sorry with a proof `0 < n` , of course). This would make it able to be used as a simp lemma.
I've revised those two lemma statements as suggested.

This seems like it should follow from [`List.ofFn_eq_pmap`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/List/FinRange.html#List.ofFn_eq_pmap) and [`List.find?_range_eq_some`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Init/Data/List/Nat/Range.html#List.find?_range_eq_some).

`ofFn_eq_pmap` doesn't leave things in a good form for applying `find?_range_eq_some` (either on its own or with `find?_pmap` applied in between). If there are other API lemmas (existing or new) that can be applied to achieve the translation to `find?` on `range`, it's not clear to me what they would be.

```
theorem find?_eq_some' {xs : List α} {p : α → Bool} {b : α} : 
    xs.find? p = some b ↔ p b ∧ ∃ i h, xs[i] = b ∧ ∀ j : Nat, (hj : j < i) → !p (xs[j]'(sorry))
```    
would be a better intermediate step.

```
theorem find?_eq_some_iff_getElem {xs : List α} {p : α → Bool} {b : α} :
    xs.find? p = some b ↔ p b ∧ ∃ i h, xs[i] = b ∧ ∀ j : Nat, (hj : j < i) → !p xs[j] := by
  rw [find?_eq_some]
  simp only [Bool.not_eq_eq_eq_not, Bool.not_true, exists_and_right, and_congr_right_iff]
  intro w
  constructor
  · rintro ⟨as, ⟨bs, rfl⟩, h⟩
    refine ⟨as.length, ⟨?_, ?_, ?_⟩⟩
    · simp only [length_append, length_cons]
      refine Nat.lt_add_of_pos_right (zero_lt_succ bs.length)
    · rw [getElem_append_right (Nat.le_refl as.length)]
      simp
    · intro j h'
      rw [getElem_append_left h']
      exact h _ (getElem_mem h')
  · rintro ⟨i, h, rfl, h'⟩
    refine ⟨xs.take i, ⟨xs.drop (i+1), ?_⟩, ?_⟩
    · rw [getElem_cons_drop, take_append_drop]
    · intro a m
      rw [mem_take_iff_getElem] at m
      obtain ⟨j, h, rfl⟩ := m
      apply h'
      omega
```

I'll put this in Lean, but if you want to put it in Mathlib in the meantime that's fine.

(I might also rename the existing `find?_eq_some` as ` find?_eq_some_iff_append` to more clearly distinguish them.)
I've copied that lemma into `Mathlib.Data.List.OfFn` (as a temporary location since there isn't an obvious better one imported by that file) and refactored `find?_ofFn_eq_some` in terms of it.
There's already `last_ofFn` with this statement. Could you deprecate that in favour of this?
I've done that deprecation (also added `getLast_ofFn_succ` to deprecate `last_ofFn_succ`).

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Data/List): lemmas about `ofFn`
